text: Beauty, more than bitterness, makes the heart break.
author: Sara Teasdale

text: I thought to be feminine was to give in to straight culture, or the beauty standard, but in my heart I had a flair for fashion and style. They were passions I kept secret because I didn't understand I could love clothes and hair and makeup and still like girls.
author: Beth Ditto

text: Thanks to capitalism, the importance placed on beauty has never been so manipulated. We are the guinea pigs force-fed ads that tell us how pathetic we are: that we will never be loved, happy or valuable unless we have the body, the face, the hair, even the personality that will apparently be ours, if only we buy their products.
author: Beth Ditto

text: She gave up beauty in her tender youth, gave all her hope and joy and pleasant ways she covered up her eyes lest they should gaze on vanity, and chose the bitter truth.
author: Christina Rossetti

text: I really like to be able to have variety and to try different things - that's the beauty of fashion.
author: Leighton Meester
